topic.title: ZeroNet dying?
topic.body: I started ZeroNet 1 month ago and am enjoying zites: ZeroTalk is active and interesting; making zites lets me feel fun. ZeroNet is like a practical Freent for me. I want to enjoy this from here on also... But won't ZeroNet be developed as its newer versions? Github said the last version of Zeronet was released 2019. Is ZeroNet dying? If yes, my sad... How do you feel?

1614952464_15PBP7E1m1G82N5r5AoXUFMinSuqD.body:
> [mfs](#comment_122_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6Xk2a7W): Kind of wondering why we haven't seen an update. Maybe it's not needed?

This zite said its version is 0.7.*2* in content.json. Forking exists?
GalactiChan
http://127.0.0.1:43110/19HKdTAeBh5nRiKn791czY7TwRB1QNrf1Q/

> [zeroseed4](#comment_89_1HTbdyz4zToxkxfmuYYfNVN1Y3U2yeki1N): You can update to 0.72 by using zeronet updated. This fix most Sync bugs

Thanks, advice! I updated my ZeroNet from http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPDaT3uSyWAPdCv1WkMb5hBQjWSNNACf
This seems to mean that its development was alive at least until September, 2020. I feel a bit hope...
